name: beta-amyrin 11-oxidase
classes: Acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen;
With reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen into the other donor
reaction: beta-amyrin + 2 [reduced NADPH---hemoprotein reductase] + 2 O2 = 11-oxo-beta-amyrin + 2 [oxidized NADPH---hemoprotein reductase] + 3 H2O (overall reaction) [RN:R09817]; (1a) beta-amyrin + [reduced NADPH---hemoprotein reductase] + O2 = 11alpha-hydroxy-beta-amyrin + [oxidized NADPH---hemoprotein reductase] + H2O [RN:R09815]; (1b) 11alpha-hydroxy-beta-amyrin + [reduced NADPH---hemoprotein reductase] + O2 = 11-oxo-beta-amyrin + [oxidized NADPH---hemoprotein reductase] + 2 H2O [RN:R09816]
comment: A cytochrome P-450 (heme-thiolate) protein from the plant Glycyrrhiza uralensis (Chinese licorice) that participates in the glycyrrhizin biosynthesis pathway. The enzyme is also able to oxidize 30-hydroxy-beta-amyrin to 11alpha,30-dihydroxy-beta-amyrin but this is not thought to be part of glycyrrhizin biosynthesis.

references.title: Licorice beta-amyrin 11-oxidase, a cytochrome P450 with a key role in the biosynthesis of the triterpene sweetener glycyrrhizin.
references.journal: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 105:14204-9 (2008) DOI:10.1073/pnas.0803876105
